sub_title: Founder @ Progeny Leadership | Human-centered Coaching Strategies
summary:
I am an experienced and certified executive coach, sales leader, and author, with over 25+ years of success in driving personal and business results for global clients. As the Managing Director of Progeny Leadership, I lead our professional services to help organizations create teams of innovators, empower inclusivity, and enable both men and women to become hyper effective and happy career trailblazers.

My passion is to help clients achieve outstanding results by applying human-centered coaching frameworks and strategies, based on my extensive knowledge and research on gender equality and diversity in leadership. I also leverage my background in sales leadership, new business development, and customer relationship management, to help clients grow their revenues and market share. I am the author of a book on the role of leaders in advancing gender equality and belonging in the workplace, and a frequent speaker and contributor on this topic.

profile_positions.description:
As the Managing Director of Progeny Leadership, I lead our professional services to help clients achieve outstanding results. 

We create teams of innovators. We empower inclusivity. We help both men and women break out of gendered stereotypes to become hyper effective and happy career trail blazers — helping companies realise significant sales growth through human centered coaching frameworks and strategies.

Clients: Global Profit & Non-Profit, Fortune 500 Corporations, Fortune 100 Small Businesses
Our hybrid offering of coaching, training, and facilitation allows us to create solutions tailor-made to the needs of our clients.  

Working exclusively with individual Executives and Senior Leaders, as well as organisations, we offer:

» Diversity & Inclusivity Coaching
» Executive Leadership Coaching
» Sales Excellence Coaching 

Credentials:

» Corporate Diversity & Inclusivity Coach, Center for Executive Coaching
» Associate Certified Coach, International Coach Federation
» Women’s Leadership Coach, Center for Executive Coaching
» Executive Leadership Coach, Center for Executive Coaching
» Master Facilitation Coach, Center for Executive Coaching 

Publication:

Gender Dimensions in Leadership: Reflections, perceptions and perspectives on inclusivity - for executives and coaches. (2020)
__________ 

Connect with me for more information about how Progeny Leadership can help you and your organisation. 
__________

Progeny Leadership develops exceptional leaders, who achieve exceptional business results. We work with clients in the United States, Europe, the Middle East, Australia, and Asia.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director, Founder » Global Leadership Development

profile_positions.description:
In 2017, I launched and established Concord Direct, a professional services firm specialising in finding European sales people for European roles in organisations based in North America. 

I lead all aspects of the business, including operations, business development, client relations, staff management, finance, among others. 

Concord Direct typically recruits into these areas:

» Medical Device Sales
» Clinical Software Sales
» Technical and Engineering Sales

Additional professional services include psychometric testing, leadership assessment, and HR and people management.   
__________

Concord Direct specialises finding European sales people for European roles in organisations based in North America.
profile_positions.title: Founder » Professional Services Firm

profile_positions.description:
After my sabbatical, I accepted the role of International Business Development Director at Biomedical Systems, where I was responsible for software sales for Europe and Middle East. 

In April 2009, I took maternity leave and subsequently left to concentrate on family and portfolio work. 
__________

Biomedical Systems, a well-recognised provider of reliable imaging, as well as cardiac safety and respiratory data collection solutions was acquired by ERT in September 2017.
profile_positions.title: International Business Development Director » Sales Leadership

profile_positions.location: Zhuhai/Guangdong, China; Kathmandu/Chitwan, Nepal; Tamil Nadu, India; Romania
profile_positions.description:
In 2008, I decided to take an international charity/voluntary work sabbatical. My work here spanned 20 months, where I travelled to multiple countries, helping people through various organisations. These included: 

AidCamps International | SCAD | Rural Community Development Program (RCDP)
The Marist Brothers | TEFL International

With a passion for helping children, families, and communities in need, I found great reward in contributing my time, and continue to contribute in any way I can to the needs of the global community. Details about organisations and work are in my Volunteer section.
profile_positions.title: Sabbatical, Global » Volunteer | Sales & Business Education Teacher

profile_positions.description:
In 2004, I was selected as the Senior Director for International Business Development for ERT, a top 3 Fortune 100 small business, with responsibility for commercial accounts across Europe and the Middle East. 

The scope of my individual responsibilities amounted to 25% of ERT’s total annual revenue, (while there was a global sales team of 14 people), selling cardiac safety software to corporate clients. This included many new upcoming biotech companies that were breaking into new markets, compounds, and countries. I found and incorporated an entirely new pipeline of work, leading to more diverse compounds and markets feeding into our sales pipeline, which ultimately led to many more collaborations and partnerships mid-to long term. And subsequently to becoming key Account Manager for our biggest client.

Early experiences in my career, such as this role with ERT, were formative for me in building a dedicated global perspective for business success as well as endowing me with a deeper understanding of different cultures and people. Working with professionalism and integrity, I developed and strengthened business relationships central to our business development goals. This led me to becoming the top international BD person selling independently a territory of $19.5M, with jointly/globally a total of $46.5M.

In 2004, ERT was cited as 2nd and 3rd-fastest growing US small business. 

» Top Sales Performer, Global Accounts (2006)
» Top Sales Achiever Commercial Global Accounts (2005) 
__________

ERT is a global data and technology company that minimizes uncertainty and risk in clinical trials so that our customers can move ahead with confidence.
profile_positions.title: Senior Director, International Business Development » Key Global Accounts

profile_positions.description:
As the Director for European Sales, I had the opportunity to build diverse relationships across the continent, leading and implementing sales strategies for selling e-diary and clinical data management/EDC tools to Pharmaceutical clients. 

Responsibilities included the management of Arracel’s Key Account: Pfizer. 

» Delivered excellence in sales leadership —first to achieve over $1M new business in new product pre-launch
» Grew sales pipeline from $1.6M to $3.8M  
» Sold 90% of entire business (2002)
__________

eTrials Worldwide Inc. is a global provider of integrated software. eTrials was established to help guide companies through the evolution from paper to electronic data processes.
profile_positions.title: Director for European Sales » Sales Leadership | Key Account Management

profile_positions.description:
Continuing my path as a sales leader, I joined Phase Forward in the role of Business Development Manager, where I was responsible for the sales of data management systems and clinical trials safety systems to pharmaceutical companies and contract research organisations. 
__________

Phase Forward, a leading provider of integrated data collection and data management solutions for clinical trials and drug safety, was acquired by Oracle in 2010.
profile_positions.title: Business Development Manager » Sales Leadership | Strategy

profile_positions.description:
My dedication to inclusivity has always been central to my sales accomplishments. 

Trained in general surgery, gynaecology and colorectal procedures in the US, I subsequently worked in the Operating Theatre setting, consulting with the hospital staff on all things related to  the medical equipment I was trained on. This was a broad range of stapling devices in open surgery and laparoscopic instrumentation for  key hole surgery. 

As a Territory Manager for Johnson & Johnson early in my career, I worked inclusively with multiple stakeholders, from top surgeons to nurses and hospital buyers and management. With responsibilities for national projects, I leveraged those relationships to build quality and trust and influence into my offering for my customers; dealing with the internal management and politics to get the support I needed despite internal challenges with staffing, equipment, or delivery.

I simultaneously created and developed the highest earning territory in a national team of 30 company representatives. Also responsible for recruiting new sales people to EES and helped in creating commission plan in 2001. Additional responsibilities included training, as well as advisement of negligence law and risk management within the hospital setting.

My work ethic and inclusive approach delighted customers and propelled outstanding results as a female in a male-dominated environment. I derived much personal satisfaction, knowing I did my best to serve all stakeholders well. 

» First Member of EES Millionaire Club (1999) — first sales person to achieve a $1M territory in J&J history 
» Rookie of the Year Award (1998)
 __________

Johnson & Johnson is the largest and most broadly based healthcare company in the world, producing life-changing breakthroughs every day.
profile_positions.title: Territory Manager, Ethicon Endo Surgery » Business Development | Sales Leadership | Revenue Growth

profile_positions.description:
Selling recruitment and sales training of graduates.

Directly involved in assessment of potential graduates in UK and the Netherlands, and in their subsequent training. Responsibility for meta's key account, Johnson & Johnson.

» 50% selection and 98% retention of graduates after first year in employment, exceptional in the industry.
profile_positions.title: Sales Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Set-up of start-up Waste Minimisation Ltd.

Compiled feasibility study of energy efficiency services and relevance for small to medium-sized business. Responsible for writing up study and gaining the award of  0.5M sterling from European Community. 

» This was the very first study of it's type in the UK. Experience included 6 month business process re-engineering project with Price Waterhouse Coopers (now Deloitte Coopers.)
profile_positions.title: Business Analyst

volunteer_experiences.description:
MicroLoan Foundation provides small loans, training, mentoring and on-going support to some of the most vulnerable women in sub-Saharan Africa, allowing them to start small businesses for themselves.
By helping women to help themselves, the organization’s work is having a lasting impact on the lives of women, children and families in sub-Saharan Africa.

» Creating content for the Foundation’s education hub

AidCamps International is a small, friendly, well-established registered UK charity, taking volunteers from the UK and elsewhere to participate in short-term voluntary projects in developing countries. The organisation’s primary purpose is to provide grassroots development aid. Most   projects focus on the construction of schools, medical centres and other practical buildings to benefit developing communities.

» Set up the Sarah Drijfhout Nepal Private Education fund for impoverished children to attend private schools with better facilities in Nepal. Raised more than $10,000 to date.

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer, Social Change and Development Program, Tamil Nadu, India
volunteer_experiences.description:
SCAD Group of Institutions is an offshoot of SCAD (Social Change and Development) a socially committed institution striving for the development of deprived communities in Southern India for more than 30 years.

» Aid work for dalits, teaching English, helping with disabled children in Tamil Nadu, India.

company.name: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

volunteer_experiences.description: Provide International Business Development training to business students

The International School Groningen serves the needs of the International Community in the north of the Netherlands. Through the International Baccalaureate Organisation the school provides high quality English language education in a pleasant, secure and stimulating environment to students aged from 11 to 18.

International Alert helps people find peaceful solutions to conflict. International Alert is one of the world’s leading peacebuilding organisations, with 30 years of experience laying the foundations for peace.

International TEFL Academy is an award-winning worldwide training organization working in over 80 nations worldwide. I was based in China.

» Business and sales coaching to Chinese business people
Old people's befriender, social contact, taking out from care home

Registered in 1998 in Nepal, with Social Welfare Council, RCDP Nepal is a non-profit, non-political, non-religious volunteer organization. It has been running community-based volunteer programs in urban and rural areas of Nepal, by carrying out many schools and orphanages-based volunteer projects.

» Volunteer to Nepalese displaced children's home/rehabilitation centre. Personally set up ongoing education fund, fundraising project campaigns.

Bucharest, Romania

» General care and teaching of Romanian orphans

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer, Raleigh International UK, expedition Guyana, South America
volunteer_experiences.description: 3 month expedition to remote impoverished areas of Guyana. Malarial screening work and construction of health centre in remote village. Voluntary teaching, expedition administration at HQ in Georgetown.
